page.title: 14BIRDLIFE:STENIGOT-CAWKWELL
page.content: In the large,open fields around Cawkwell,wintering flocks of {Golden- {Plover}& {Lapwing}can be seen & some- times,{Curlew.} On the chalk downland and surrounding hedges & bushes at RED HILL nature re- serve,are{Meadow Pipit,Skylark,Linnet, {Yellow Hammer}&{Corn Bunting.}The gra- ssy banks are used for hunting by{ {Kestrel,Barn }&{Tawney Owl.}Wintering {Fieldfare}&{Redwing }feed on the fruit of the hawthorn. In the large mixed woods of Stenigot, are Summer migrants like{Black Cap,Wh- {ite Throat,Chiff Chaff}&{Spotted Fly- {Catcher.}Also the{Great Sp.W'pecker, {Sparrow Hawk,Goldcrest,Red Poll,Tree- {Creeper,Woodcock}&{Brambling}(Winter). Along the stream from Scamblesby to Goulceby are{Kingfisher,Heron,Snipe, {Reed Bunting }and{Sedge Warbler.
